intent_atoms.description: SDK consumers can opt into tolerant parsing via ISOInspectorKit.ParseOptions and use corruption-resilient parsing in their applications.

SDK documentation is created for tolerant parsing (TolerantParsingGuide.md) with at least 3 working code examples: basic setup, accessing corruption metrics from ParseIssueStore, comparing strict vs. tolerant behavior.
ParsePipeline.Options, .strict and .tolerant presets have inline documentation with usage notes.
Documentation explains when to use tolerant mode and how to interpret ParseIssue results.
Article is linked from main ISOInspectorKit.docc/Documentation.md Topics section.
swift package generate-documentation succeeds and renders the new guide without errors.
ParsePipeline.Options API must remain public with .strict and .tolerant presets available.
Add DocC comments to ParsePipeline.Options struct in ISOInspectorKit/ISO/ParsePipeline.swift.
Create new article TolerantParsingGuide.md under Sources/ISOInspectorKit/ISOInspectorKit.docc/Articles with specified sections and code samples.
Update main catalog Documentation.md to add a new "Tolerant Parsing" topic linking to <doc:TolerantParsingGuide>.

Create executable test examples in Tests/ISOInspectorKitTests/Examples/TolerantParsingExamples.swift and documentation tests in Tests/ISOInspectorKitTests/Documentation/TolerantParsingDocTests.swift to verify code samples compile and run.
